node.title: Southern Queenslanders on high alert as major flooding sends towns underwater amid days-long deluge
node.description: Heavy rain is easing today across southern Queensland but, with catchments already saturated, hundreds of residents in Inglewood, Yelarbon and Texas will remain on high alert after major floodingÂ inundated homes.
node.content:
["Heavy rain is easing today across southern Queensland but, with catchments already saturated, hundreds of residents in Inglewood, Yelarbon and Texas will remain on high alert after major flooding\u00a0inundated homes.", "The days-long deluge of heavy rainfall has soaked the state's south-east, leaving homes flooded, towns evacuated and sparking\u00a0hundreds of emergency calls for help in what has been the wettest November some areas have seen in more than 100 years.", "BOM forecaster Harry Clark said people in affected areas shouldn't expect floodwaters to subside quickly, that even scattered showers could cause further flooding, particularly in the border region.", "Floodwater in the Macintyre Brook is expected to peak in Texas today and in Goondiwindi either tonight or tomorrow.\u00a0", "At a\u00a0conservative estimate, it could reach 10.5 metres, which is below the levy.", "Overnight, three people were rescued near Dalby, north-west of Toowoomba, after clinging to a tree in floodwaters for three hours.", "Nearly 50 people were evacuated from the small town of Yelarbon, however,\u00a0Goondiwindi Mayor Lawrence Springborg said they would be allowed to return later this morning.", "\"The water peaked just upstream of Yelarbon in the early hours of this morning but we're hopeful, at this stage, we won't see that water intrusion but we wanted to act with an abundance of caution,\" Mr Springborg said.", "Meanwhile, the Macintyre Brook peaked at Inglewood yesterday morning,\u00a0just below the historic 1976 flood level of 11.73 metres.", "Inglewood resident Grant Cooper evacuated his home with his family on Tuesday night after the SES knocked on the door and advised them to leave.", "He said he thought the water would have probably reached the floorboards of their home.", "", "
Some evacuated residents in Inglewood are beginning to return home.(Supplied: QFES\u00a0)
", "\"We probably had about four hours until the bridge shut. It is pretty sad because we know all the business owners and we feel for them,\" Mr Cooper\u00a0said.", "Meanwhile, Steve Wakerley, who lives at Kooroongarra, 45 kilometres north-east\u00a0of Inglewood, said the roads around his home had been cut off, so he and his family were planning to stay put.", "He estimated about 120 millimetres of rain had\u00a0fallen on his property after the region's heavy rainfall.\u00a0", "\"Plenty of creeks are up and people are stuck where they are for a couple of days,\" Mr Wakerley said.", "\"We didn't need any rain. It's been raining a lot locally, which I think has probably contributed to the flooding,\" he said.", "\"We have had some good rain in the last months, so the ground is already pretty wet, so there has been a lot of run off as a result.\"", "
Rescue teams respond to hundreds of calls for help
", "QFES Commissioner\u00a0Greg Leach\u00a0said that, in the past few days, emergency services teams had received 27 calls for help from people trapped in cars caught in floodwaters in need of rescuing.", "The SES received 476 requests for help, 228 of which were in Brisbane.", "He again urged people not to enter floodwaters in any circumstances.", "\"A modern motor vehicle can float in as little as 15 centimetres of swift moving water, so you might think that your vehicle can get through but you can't, it's too dangerous so please heed the message,\" he said.", "\"Back it up and find an alternative route.", "\"In a couple of cases, we have had to rescue people from\u00a0the floodwaters, people take refuge on the roof of their vehicles or cling to a tree and that puts our personnel at danger in having to go in and rescue them.", "", "
QFES\u00a0Commissioner Greg Leach says driving through floodwaters is \"inexcusable\".(ABC News: Curtis Rodda)
", "Commissioner Leach reminded property owners to stay vigilant, heed\u00a0flood warnings and be aware of how far their\u00a0properties are from\u00a0floodwaters.", "\"As the water moves down catchments, people need to understand where they live in the flood catchment that they live in and take note of the conditions,\" Commissioner\u00a0Leach said.", "\"Understand not only what water there is in your area, but what water is coming your way.\"\u00a0", "He said while he hoped the region would enjoy a reprieve in coming days, another weather system was due to hit next week.", "\"Now that our catchments are saturated, whatever rain we get from here on those river levels are going to rise again very quickly,\" he said.", "
Major flood warnings in place across the south east
", "Residents in the border town of\u00a0Texas have been\u00a0on high alert overnight as floodwaters rose in the Dumaresq River, which flows through the centre of town.", "Bureau of Meteorologist hydrologist Andrew Preece said floodwaters that were easing around Inglewood would head downstream.", "He said flows from the McIntyre Brook and Dumaresq River would come together at Bengalla.", "\"We're expecting that to peak around the major flood level of 10 metres [on Thursday] or Friday,\" Mr Preece told ABC Radio Brisbane.", "\"That will work its way down to Bogabilla and Goondiwindi around Friday and into the weekend.\"", "Mr Preece\u00a0said the bureau would need to wait for the peak floodwater levels at Bengalla before predicting how Goondiwindi might be impacted.", "Major flood warnings remain in place for the Bremer River and Warrill Creek Catchments, the Condamine River, the Dawon River, the Logan River, the Macintyre Brook and the Warrego River.", "Moderate flood warnings are in place for Charleys Creek, Callide Creek, Weir River, Burnett River and Paroo River."]
